metadata.title: CVE-2022-42856 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A type confusion issue was addressed with improved state handling. Thisissue is fixed in Safari 16.2, tvOS 16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, iOS 15.7.2and iPadOS 15.7.2, iOS 16.1.2. Processing maliciously crafted web contentmay lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that thisissue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS releasedbefore iOS 15.1..

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
